topicSummary: Acne rosacea is a chronic relapsing skin condition affecting the face, characterized by episodes of facial flushing, erythema, telangiectasia.

topicHtmlObjects.htmlHeader: Rosacea - acne: Summary

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Adverse effects updated within prescribing information - metronidazole.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Information added on contraindication and adverse effects of brimonidine gel following advice from the MHRA: https://www.gov.uk/drug-safety-update/brimonidine-gel-mirvaso-risk-of-systemic-cardiovascular-effects-not-to-be-applied-to-damaged-skin.

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Information added on the risk of exacerbation of rosacea with brimonidine gel.

latestChanges.title: Reviewed
latestChanges.body: A literature search was conducted in December 2015 to identify evidence-based guidelines, UK policy, systematic reviews, and key randomized controlled trials published since the last revision of the topic. The topic has been updated in line with a Cochrane systematic review Interventions for rosacea Van Zuuren et al, 2015, and topical brimonidine 0.5% gel has been added as a treatment option. Minor restructuring of the topic has also been undertaken.
